comments.text:
The *common ancestor of Barack Obama and George W. Bush* were Pilgrims and 
lived at the beginning of the 17th century in England. The devout 
Protestants, however, were persecuted. That's why they fled in 1609 in the 
liberal Holland. In the city of Leiden, they could practice their religion 
freely. *One of the Pilgrim Mothers is direct maternal ancestor Obama. And 
the brother of the Pilgrim Mother is an ancestor of Obama's predecessor, 
George Bush.*

In Leiden is a plaque with the names of families who set out in 1620 with 
the famous "Mayflower" to America. On the panel are also the names of 
Thomas Blossom, his wife and their daughter Elizabeth. *Barack Obama's 
mother is descended from this Elizabeth.* Franklin Roosevelt also had 
ancestors in Leiden, as the Bush family: Elizabeth Blossoms brother Peter. 
Obama is now the eighth president who comes from the Pilgrims in Leiden.

Why the Pilgrims left Holland one day? At some point was even Holland them 
too liberal, they were afraid the wickedness in the land of dykes. And 
that's why they dared in 1620, the crossing to America. And today will be 
one of their descendants of the 44th President of the United States.

*Hail the faith in democracy!*﻿

comments.author: Abe Martin

comments.text:
+Velvet Rose
So what are you saying-you would rather the Republicans get in again? I've 
heard all the Hillary bashing from progressives, and it frankly amazes me. 
When Hillary Clinton came up here to Canada to take a look at our health 
care system, she made a very good impression--and was vilified as some kind 
of communist for it, when she got home. Right now, she has had to dance the 
center right dance, but if she gets into the Oval Office I think she would 
move aggressively to repair some of the damage the Republicans have done to 
the US. I think, like Obama, she would fight for an effective public health 
care system for Americans. I also think she would vote for campaign finance 
reform, which is crucial to the continued existence of American democracy.

comments.author: Harry Johnson

comments.text:
Elizabeth Warren is the only person I am currently considering supporting 
for President (if only she would run). The entire Republican field 
is completely loony and Hillary Clinton is Obama 2 (pushover who holds no 
strong positions- only those her donors agree with). It is a shame WB is 
not running currently because though Republican voters are brainwashed into 
thinking "Liberal Bad.. Brains" she is truly on our side and is best for 
the country.


Listen. I would be highly, highly surprised if a Republican were to win in 
2016. Considering the current crop, the rest of the world would point and 
laugh. In the meantime I would move to Canada and wait out the storm until 
it is safe to come out only to move back and repair all the damage that was 
done to our country. But that's not going to happen.

What is going to happen is Hillary Clinton is going to run and win. The 
country will continue to head towards more of the same. She will continue 
to give Democrats a bad name and make them look like they stand for 
nothing. As a consequence Republicans will continue to gain 
Congressmen/Women and NOTHING WILL GET DONE. Democrats should have easily 
taken over the country by now because of the complete horse $#!% the 
opposition is spewing from the other side of the isle. The problem is that 
most Democrats have no backbone, they don't stand for moral principals they 
claim to believe in, and they don't call Republicans out for the crap they 
spew. This isn't exactly appealing to Independent voters either. Elizabeth 
Warren is a welcome exception.

We need her right now because currently the nation is up for grabs between 
ignorant people on one side and pushovers on the other. I'm sure some of 
you will disagree with my statement. Have at it.﻿

comments.text:
"Republics decline into democracies and democracies degenerate into 
despotisms." ~ Aristotle 

"The more corrupt the state, the more numerous the laws." ~ Tacitus 

"Behind the ostensible government sits enthroned an invisible government 
owing no allegiance and acknowledging no responsibility to the people. " ~ 
Theodore Roosevelt 

“Government is not reason, it is not eloquence, it is force; like fire, a 
troublesome servant and a fearful master. Never for a moment should it be 
left to irresponsible action.” ~ George Washington 

"The spirit of resistance to government is so valuable on certain 
occasions, that I wish it to be always kept alive. It will often be 
exercised when wrong, but better so than not to be exercised at all. I like 
a little rebellion now and then." ~ Thomas Jefferson 

“Experience hath shewn, that even under the best forms (of government) 
those entrusted with power have, in time, and by slow operations, perverted 
it into tyranny.” ~ Thomas Jefferson 

“Fear is the foundation of most governments; but it is so sordid and brutal 
a passion, and renders men in whose breasts it predominates so stupid and 
miserable, that Americans will not be likely to approve of any political 
institution which is founded on it.” ~ John Adams (Were it so today) 

"The truth is that all men having power ought to be mistrusted." ~ James 
Madison 

“There are more instances of the abridgment of the freedom of the people by 
the gradual and silent encroachment of those in power, than by violent and 
sudden usurpation.” ~ James Madison 

"Resistance to tyrants is obedience to God." ~ Benjamin Franklin 

"Government, in it's last analysis, is organized force". ~ Woodrow Wilson 

"Government is a disease masquerading as it's own cure". ~ L. Neal Smith 

"Government in it's best state, is but a necessary evil, in it's worse 
state, an intolerable one." ~ Thomas Paine 

“A government that is big enough to give you all you want is big enough to 
take it all away.” ~ Barry Goldwater﻿

comments.text:
I , for one, have been a big supporter of Mrs. Warren as one of the only 
viable, worthwhile politicians today.
Sadly, that has changed as of today. 
Below is my letter to Senator Warrens office this morning;
*__________________________________________________*

Hello Senator Warren,,,
I have been one of your number one supporter for several years.

Sadly, it has come to my attention today that you are a support of the 
on-going crimes committed by the out law state of Israel.

 Israel has been thumbing it arrogant nose at countless United Nations 
Resolutions for decades. Israel consistently operates it terrorist state 
outside of international law and has been stealing land along murdering 
those it has stolen from since 1948. The U.S. need to dump the Israeli 
parasite.﻿

I have been a supporter of Warren. But, I will need to reevaluate that in 
light of Warren supporting the Israeli theft of land and on-going genocide 
since 1948. The United States needs to rid itself of the Israeli parasite, 
which ONLY buys us more enemies.

Very sorry to see this important issue come between us Senator Warren. But 
in my thinking, if you are gullible to go along with the Israeli coercion 
of our government, then I can offer nothing but opposition to your 
misguided agenda.

VERY sad about this Senator,,, I will watch to see if you acquire some 
intelligence and clarity on this important problem.

Good bye, sadly, Loren Salazar

P.S. I would love to hear from your office on this serious shortcoming on 
your part.

maybe a hundred billion a year, the military amounts to about 800 million a

pretty much all corporate tax breaks and subsidies there will have to be 
some cuts, and some tax increases to keep the social programs going.

comments.text:
If the Monsanto-labelling issue is the only grievance the true Left has 
with Elizabeth Warren, I'd say pull your head out and look at the bigger 
issues. 
GMO-labelling is one issue that really does have logical opposition. 
Farming isn't natural, never has been. But it's necessary to our survival. 
Genetic engineering of produce is going to save a lot of lives -- already 
has. And I'd argue genetic engineering is more natural than the 
mass-spraying of herbicides and pesticides that we've been living with for 
almost a century now.

If this issue is the only fault you have with her, then I think you need to 
get over it. There are such bigger concerns at stake.

If you have problems with some of her other positions, I'd genuinely like 
to hear them.

comments.text:
+1disaffected Blatant demagoguery the only way you can win is to put words 
in my mouth how typical.
"Barskor, do you think it is wise to put a giant chemical plant just 
upstream of a large city without doing an environmental impact studies? " I 
think it is a waste that once the study is done that those who buy or 
inherit the factory have to repeat that study even though nothing has 
changed. The proof is in the regulation requiring the studies as every 
transferal counts as a new business.

Before the Clean Air Act people forced polluters to fix problems through 
civil laws suites and now they can't as the legislation that formed the EPA 
vested that power to the EPA and cancer ally from oil refineries in the 
southern states still exists due to the EPA only applying tiny fines and 
approving toxin levels.

Policing Wall Street is easy they make bad investments and they go out of 
business and the public learns to pay attention to their investments 
instead of blindly dumping money on Hucksters. But you Rewarded them with 
bailouts and quantitative easing so they have no incentive to stop their 
behavior.

OSHA can be eliminated by simply using the negligent homicide and assault 
laws as they have far greater penalties and are readily enforceable.

Work hours and wages is a simple matter that resolves it's self when 
competition is allowed IE workers are unhappy with 80 hours a week they can 
go to a business that wants happier more productive workers that offers 
them lower hours per week and it happened back in the 1900's those who 
didn't like it Moved on and the factory owners had to import more workers 
who then moved on in successive waves.
Wages rise when businesses have a limited labor pool and the only real way 
to shrink that pool is to increase the number of businesses drawing from it.
Your 40 hour week has been destroyed by the Affordable Care Act given that 
in order to avoid the penalties hours are being cut to less than 29 per 
week and that means many people will have to get two jobs  increasing the 
hours worked overall to above 40. It does give a nice illusion that the 
economy is improving however due to the want ads to fill those new part 
time jobs.

Capitalism exists without government regulations Bitcoin and other 
cryptocurrencies for example. E-Bay has no law enforcement of their 
commerce. The Barter Clubs of Argentina for another. Black markets and Grey 
markets as well.
comments.author: Barskor1

comments.text:
+Barskor1 You are getting closer but still not there.  Say something like 
this;

" I want the Clean Air Act Repealed." or
" I want the Pure Food and Drug Act    Repealed."
"I want the Sherman AntiTrust act Repealed"
"I want the Occupational Safety and Health Act Repealed"

Barskor, do you think it is wise to put a giant chemical plant just 
upstream of a large city without doing an environmental impact studies? 
 You talk about the cost of regulations, what is the cost of treating the 
cancers caused by pollutants?  The public must pay  that cost with their 
lives.  You talk about the cost of policing Wall Street, what about the 
life savings of millions stolen by unscrupulous trade practices.  Who bears 
the cost, when a worker is killed in an unsafe work environment?  Did you 
know that workers once had an 80 hour work week?  Was that changed because 
Big Business suddenly became nice guys?  NO, it was regulatory laws that 
made the the 40 hour work week!
As a historian I can assure you, there have been actual and near 
revolutions fought for these very reasons.  Without Regulations Capitalism 
could not exist!

Ps. Please, cite a case where a *new* environmental study was required when 
a business was sold.  I'm not doubting your word I just cannot find a case.
comments.author: 1disaffected

comments.text:
+MATTHEW QUIGLEY  There are over 750 thousand Federal regulations a similar 
amount of State regulations and then you have City ordinances, it is a 
literal can't see the forest for the trees problem. There are hundreds of 
outdated and unneeded equipment requirements due to advances in tech per 
level of government. There is paper work for reporting every gallon on fuel 
used for rocketry testing in private space programs ten pages of work PER 
GALLON.
There is the Environmental Impact, Traffic Impact studies costing tens of 
thousands of dollars for opening a business that are required to be 
repeated when a business is sold or inherited even though the type, size 
and location of the business never changes.
And so on.
comments.author: Barskor1

comments.text:
+Barskor1 **I DON'T KNOW HOW TO ASK IT ANY CLEARER.  WHAT SPECIFIC 
REGULATION DO YOU WANT TO REPEAL?**
You didn't name one because you didn't know one.  You only know what the 
GOP told you.
Please, answer the question.
comments.author: MATTHEW QUIGLEY

comments.text:
+MATTHEW QUIGLEY Dear Comrade/State Capitalist/Fascist. we have laws 
against poisoning people simply enforce them. We have laws against dumping 
garbage in public spaces simply enforce them.
We have laws against fraud and theft simply enforce them.
If your credit card company is cheating you cancel your credit card.
Yes my food would be safe as I don't buy from people who make crappy food 
and if more people did no one would make crappy food. I grow most of what I 
want anyway.

Regulations are written by corporations handed to lobbyists then 
politicians and are what keeps out competition and forms Oligarchies that 
we are currently suffering with.

Simply examine the costs to comply with a regulation now an established 
corporation can handle that cost but a new company has to raise more money 
or go deeper into debt.
comments.author: Barskor1

comments.text:
+Barskor1 So regulations are *BAD.*  Do you think big Business would not 
pour poisons in our rivers if regulations did not stop them?  Do you think

think Wall Street, Banks, credit cards, would  cheat you, if we had no

think giant monopolies would form if our regs did not stop them?  Actually 
name the  regulation you want to get rid of.  Give a specific Regulation 
that you claim is so bad. The GOP tells you Regulations are bad for 
business and you lock step (or should I say goose step) with the party 
line.  I'd rather be called Comrade than Fascist.
